metadata.dc:author: Grande Sáez, C
Camino Fernández, A
Bartolomé Albistegui, M
Rodrigo Palacios, J
Marrero Calvo, M
Merino Arribas, J
metadata.dc:description: Chronic recurrent multifocal osteomyelitis is a rare disorder of unknown etiology, characterized by multiple bone lesions and a variable clinical course. We present a 10 year old boy with chronic recurrent multifocal osteomyelitis who improved after treatment with naproxen.
metadata.dc:title: Osteomielitis crónica multifocal recurrente.
[Chronic recurrent multifocal osteomyelitis].
